answerText: Hooke's Law [10] Integrating the restoring force over the displacement gives this quantity for a spring as onehalf k times the square of the displacement.
heading: NASAT  |2014 | 16 | 11 | Science | Physics | College
subject: Science
question: Question: An alternate version of this law states that stress is equal to Young's modulus times strain. For 10 points each: [10] Name this law, usually written as F equals negative k x, that is often used to describe the restoring force in springs.
